member.summary: Return the HTTP ContentType

member.name: M:Sgml.EmbeddedResourceEntityContent.Open
member.summary: Return the encoding from HTTP header

member.name: T:Sgml.IEntityResolver
member.summary: Since .NET Portable has no FileStream and a completey differnet way to load manifest resource streams we invent an interface here to abstract out the difference from SgmlReader. Any time SgmlReader needs to load a DTD or extern DTD entity it will use this interface instead.

member.name: M:Sgml.IEntityResolver.GetContent(System.Uri)
member.summary: Open the given Uri. If the Uri is relative then it could be referring to either a local file or an embedded resource.
member.param: the absolute or relative Uri of the resource to load
member.returns: The stream, or throws exception if the resource is not found

member.name: T:Sgml.IEntityContent
member.summary: An interface that represents a loadable XML entity returned from IEntityResolver.

member.name: M:Sgml.IEntityContent.Open
member.summary: Open the stream

member.name: P:Sgml.IEntityContent.Encoding
member.summary: Return the encoding from HTTP header

member.name: P:Sgml.IEntityContent.MimeType
member.summary: Return the HTTP ContentType

member.name: P:Sgml.IEntityContent.Redirect
member.summary: Returns the redirect Uri if an HTTP redirect happened during the fetching of this resource.

member.name: T:Sgml.DeclaredContent
member.summary: Where nested subelements cannot occur within an element, its contents can be declared to consist of one of the types of declared content contained in this enumeration.

member.name: F:Sgml.DeclaredContent.Default
member.summary: Not defined.

member.name: F:Sgml.DeclaredContent.CDATA
member.summary: Character data (CDATA), which contains only valid SGML characters.

member.name: F:Sgml.DeclaredContent.RCDATA
member.summary: Replaceable character data (RCDATA), which can contain text, character references and/or general entity references that resolve to character data.

member.name: F:Sgml.DeclaredContent.EMPTY
member.summary: Empty element (EMPTY), i.e. having no contents, or contents that can be generated by the program.

member.name: T:Sgml.ContentModel
member.summary: Defines the content model for an element.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.#ctor
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Sgml.ContentModel.CurrentDepth
member.summary: The number of groups on the stack.

member.name: P:Sgml.ContentModel.DeclaredContent
member.summary: The allowed child content, specifying if nested children are not allowed and if so, what content is allowed.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.PushGroup
member.summary: Begins processing of a nested model group.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.PopGroup
member.summary: Finishes processing of a nested model group.
member.returns: The current depth of the group nesting, or -1 if there are no more groups to pop.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.AddSymbol(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new symbol to the current group's members.
member.param: The symbol to add.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.AddConnector(System.Char)
member.summary: Adds a connector onto the member list for the current group.
member.param: The connector character to add.
member.exception: If the content is not mixed and has no members yet, or if the group type has been set and the connector does not match the group type.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.AddOccurrence(System.Char)
member.summary: Adds an occurrence character for the current model group, setting it's value.
member.param: The occurrence character.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.SetDeclaredContent(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the contained content for the content model.
member.param: The text specified the permissible declared child content.

member.name: M:Sgml.ContentModel.CanContain(System.String,Sgml.SgmlDtd)
member.summary: Checks whether an element using this group can contain a specified element.
member.param: The name of the element to look for.
The DTD to use during the checking.
member.returns: true if an element using this group can contain the element, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Sgml.GroupType
member.summary: The type of the content model group, defining the order in which child elements can occur.

member.name: F:Sgml.GroupType.None
member.summary: No model group.

member.name: F:Sgml.GroupType.And
member.summary: All elements must occur, in any order.

member.name: F:Sgml.GroupType.Or
member.summary: One (and only one) must occur.

member.name: F:Sgml.GroupType.Sequence
member.summary: All element must occur, in the specified order.

member.name: T:Sgml.Occurrence
member.summary: Qualifies the occurrence of a child element within a content model group.

member.name: F:Sgml.Occurrence.Required
member.summary: The element is required and must occur only once.

member.name: F:Sgml.Occurrence.Optional
member.summary: The element is optional and must occur once at most.

member.name: F:Sgml.Occurrence.ZeroOrMore
member.summary: The element is optional and can be repeated.

member.name: F:Sgml.Occurrence.OneOrMore
member.summary: The element must occur at least once or more times.

member.name: T:Sgml.Group
member.summary: Defines a group of elements nested within another element.

member.name: P:Sgml.Group.Occurrence
member.summary: The of this group.

member.name: P:Sgml.Group.TextOnly
member.summary: Checks whether the group contains only text.
member.value: true if the group is of mixed content and has no members, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Sgml.Group.Parent
member.summary: The parent group of this group.

member.name: M:Sgml.Group.#ctor(Sgml.Group)
member.summary: Initialises a new Content Model Group.
member.param: The parent model group.

member.name: M:Sgml.Group.AddGroup(Sgml.Group)
member.summary: Adds a new child model group to the end of the group's members.
member.param: The model group to add.

member.name: M:Sgml.Group.AddSymbol(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new symbol to the group's members.
member.param: The symbol to add.

member.name: M:Sgml.Group.AddConnector(System.Char)
member.summary: Adds a connector onto the member list.
member.param: The connector character to add.
member.exception: If the content is not mixed and has no members yet, or if the group type has been set and the connector does not match the group type.

member.name: M:Sgml.Group.AddOccurrence(System.Char)
member.summary: Adds an occurrence character for this group, setting it's value.
member.param: The occurrence character.

member.name: M:Sgml.Group.CanContain(System.String,Sgml.SgmlDtd)
member.summary: Checks whether an element using this group can contain a specified element.
member.param: The name of the element to look for.
The DTD to use during the checking.
member.returns: true if an element using this group can contain the element, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Rough approximation - this is really assuming an "Or" group

member.name: T:Sgml.AttributeType
member.summary: Defines the different possible attribute types.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.Default
member.summary: Attribute type not specified.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.CDATA
member.summary: The attribute contains text (with no markup).

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.ENTITY
member.summary: The attribute contains an entity declared in a DTD.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.ENTITIES
member.summary: The attribute contains a number of entities declared in a DTD.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.ID
member.summary: The attribute is an id attribute uniquely identifie the element it appears on.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.IDREF
member.summary: The attribute value can be any declared subdocument or data entity name.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.IDREFS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) declared subdocument or data entity names.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NAME
member.summary: The attribute value is a SGML Name.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NAMES
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) SGML Names.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NMTOKEN
member.summary: The attribute value is an XML name token (i.e. contains only name characters, but in this case with digits and other valid name characters accepted as the first character).

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NMTOKENS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) XML NMTokens.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NUMBER
member.summary: The attribute value is a number.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NUMBERS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of (space separated) numbers.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NUTOKEN
member.summary: The attribute value is a number token (i.e. a name that starts with a number).

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NUTOKENS
member.summary: The attribute value is a list of number tokens.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.NOTATION
member.summary: Attribute value is a member of the bracketed list of notation names that qualifies this reserved name.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributeType.ENUMERATION
member.summary: The attribute value is one of a set of allowed names.

member.name: T:Sgml.AttributePresence
member.summary: Defines the different constraints on an attribute's presence on an element.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributePresence.Default
member.summary: The attribute has a default value, and its presence is optional.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributePresence.Fixed
member.summary: The attribute has a fixed value, if present.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributePresence.Required
member.summary: The attribute must always be present on every element.

member.name: F:Sgml.AttributePresence.Implied
member.summary: The element is optional.

member.name: T:Sgml.CaseFolding
member.summary: SGML is case insensitive, so here you can choose between converting to lower case or upper case tags. "None" means that the case is left alone, except that end tags will be folded to match the start tags.

member.name: F:Sgml.CaseFolding.None
member.summary: Do not convert case, except for converting end tags to match start tags.

member.name: F:Sgml.CaseFolding.ToUpper
member.summary: Convert tags to upper case.

member.name: F:Sgml.CaseFolding.ToLower
member.summary: Convert tags to lower case.

member.name: T:Sgml.HWStack`1
member.summary: This stack maintains a high water mark for allocated objects so the client can reuse the objects in the stack to reduce memory allocations, this is used to maintain current state of the parser for element stack, and attributes in each element.

member.name: M:Sgml.HWStack`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the HWStack class.
member.param: The amount to grow the stack space by, if more space is needed on the stack.

member.name: P:Sgml.HWStack`1.Count
member.summary: The number of items currently in the stack.

member.name: P:Sgml.HWStack`1.Size
member.summary: The size (capacity) of the stack.

member.name: P:Sgml.HWStack`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the item at the requested index or null if index is out of bounds
member.param: The index of the item to retrieve.
member.returns: The item at the requested index or null if index is out of bounds.

member.name: M:Sgml.HWStack`1.Pop
member.summary: Removes and returns the item at the top of the stack
member.returns: The item at the top of the stack.

member.name: M:Sgml.HWStack`1.Push
member.summary: Pushes a new slot at the top of the stack.
member.returns: The object at the top of the stack.
member.remarks: This method tries to reuse a slot, if it returns null then the user has to call the other Push method.

member.name: M:Sgml.HWStack`1.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove a specific item from the stack.
member.param: The index of the item to remove.

member.name: T:Sgml.Attribute
member.summary: This class represents an attribute. The AttDef is assigned from a validation process, and is used to provide default values.

member.name: M:Sgml.Attribute.Reset(System.String,System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Attribute objects are reused during parsing to reduce memory allocations, hence the Reset method.

member.name: T:Sgml.Node
M:Sgml.Node.Reset(System.String,System.Xml.XmlNodeType,System.String)
member.summary: Attribute objects are reused during parsing to reduce memory allocations, hence the Reset method.

member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the SgmlReader class.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Dtd
member.summary: Specify the SgmlDtd object directly. This allows you to cache the Dtd and share it across multipl SgmlReaders. To load a DTD from a URL use the SystemLiteral property.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Resolver
member.summary: On portable platforms the mechanism for loading files is different. For example, WinRT uses StorageFile, HttpClient and Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.ResourceLoader. So the caller must implement this interface and provide the platform specific mechanism for finding relative resources (DTDs, external entities, etc).

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.DocType
member.summary: The name of root element specified in the DOCTYPE tag.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.RootElementName
member.summary: The root element of the document.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.PublicIdentifier
member.summary: The PUBLIC identifier in the DOCTYPE tag

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.SystemLiteral
member.summary: The SYSTEM literal in the DOCTYPE tag identifying the location of the DTD.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.InternalSubset
member.summary: The DTD internal subset in the DOCTYPE tag

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.InputStream
member.summary: The input stream containing SGML data to parse. You must specify this property or the Href property before calling Read().

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.WebProxy
member.summary: Sometimes you need to specify a proxy server in order to load data via HTTP from outside the firewall. For example: "itgproxy:80".

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.SetBaseUri(System.String)
member.summary: The base Uri is used to resolve relative Uri's like the SystemLiteral and Href properties. This is a method because BaseURI is a read-only property on the base XmlReader class.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Href
member.summary: Specify the location of the input SGML document as a URL.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.StripDocType
member.summary: Whether to strip out the DOCTYPE tag from the output (default true)

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.IgnoreDtd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to ignore any DTD reference.
member.value: true if DTD references should be ignored; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.CaseFolding
member.summary: The case conversion behaviour while processing tags.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.ErrorLog
member.summary: DTD validation errors are written to this stream.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.NodeType
member.summary: The node type of the node currently being parsed.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Name
member.summary: The name of the current node, if currently positioned on a node or attribute.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.LocalName
member.summary: The local name of the current node, if currently positioned on a node or attribute.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.NamespaceURI
member.summary: The namespace of the current node, if currently positioned on a node or attribute.
member.remarks: If not positioned on a node or attribute, is returned.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Prefix
member.summary: The prefix of the current node's name.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.HasValue
member.summary: Whether the current node has a value or not.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Value
member.summary: The value of the current node.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Depth
member.summary: Gets the depth of the current node in the XML document.
member.value: The depth of the current node in the XML document.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.BaseURI
member.summary: Gets the base URI of the current node.
member.value: The base URI of the current node.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.IsEmptyElement
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current node is an empty element (for example, <MyElement/>).

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current node is an attribute that was generated from the default value defined in the DTD or schema.
member.value: true if the current node is an attribute whose value was generated from the default value defined in the DTD or schema; false if the attribute value was explicitly set.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.QuoteChar
member.summary: Gets the quotation mark character used to enclose the value of an attribute node.
member.value: The quotation mark character (" or ') used to enclose the value of an attribute node.
member.remarks: This property applies only to an attribute node.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.XmlSpace
member.summary: Gets the current xml:space scope.
member.value: One of the values. If no xml:space scope exists, this property defaults to XmlSpace.None.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.XmlLang
member.summary: Gets the current xml:lang scope.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.WhitespaceHandling
member.summary: Specifies how white space is handled.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.AttributeCount
member.summary: Gets the number of attributes on the current node.
member.value: The number of attributes on the current node.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of an attribute with the specified .
member.param: The name of the attribute to retrieve.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.GetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the attribute with the specified and .
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned. This method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.GetAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of the attribute with the specified index.
member.param: The index of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. This method does not move the reader.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of the attribute with the specified index.
member.param: The index of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. This method does not move the reader.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of an attribute with the specified .
member.param: The name of the attribute to retrieve.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.Item(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the attribute with the specified and .
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned. This method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Moves to the atttribute with the specified .
member.param: The qualified name of the attribute.
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Moves to the attribute with the specified and .
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves to the attribute with the specified index.
member.param: The index of the attribute to move to.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: Moves to the first attribute.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: Moves to the next attribute.
member.returns: true if there is a next attribute; false if there are no more attributes.
member.remarks: If the current node is an element node, this method is equivalent to . If returns true, the reader moves to the next attribute; otherwise, the position of the reader does not change.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.MoveToElement
member.summary: Moves to the element that contains the current attribute node.
member.returns: true if the reader is positioned on an attribute (the reader moves to the element that owns the attribute); false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute (the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.IsHtml
member.summary: Gets whether the content is HTML or not.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.GetEncoding
member.summary: Returns the encoding of the current entity.
member.returns: The encoding of the current entity.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next node from the stream.
member.returns: true if the next node was read successfully; false if there are no more nodes to read.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.ScanLiteral(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Char)
member.summary: Consumes and returns a literal block of text, expanding entities as it does so.
member.param: The string builder to use.
The delimiter for the literal.
member.returns: The consumed literal.
member.remarks: This version is slightly different from in that it also expands entities.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.EOF
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the reader is positioned at the end of the stream.
member.value: true if the reader is positioned at the end of the stream; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes this object.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.ReadState
member.summary: Gets the state of the reader.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.ReadContentAsString
member.summary: Reads the contents of an element or text node as a string.
member.returns: The contents of the element or an empty string.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.ReadInnerXml
member.summary: Reads all the content, including markup, as a string.
member.returns: All the XML content, including markup, in the current node. If the current node has no children, an empty string is returned. If the current node is neither an element nor attribute, an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.ReadOuterXml
member.summary: Reads the content, including markup, representing this node and all its children.
member.returns: If the reader is positioned on an element or an attribute node, this method returns all the XML content, including markup, of the current node and all its children; otherwise, it returns an empty string.

member.name: P:Sgml.SgmlReader.NameTable
member.summary: Gets the XmlNameTable associated with this implementation.
member.value: The XmlNameTable enabling you to get the atomized version of a string within the node.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.LookupNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a namespace prefix in the current element's scope.
member.param: The prefix whose namespace URI you want to resolve. To match the default namespace, pass an empty string.
member.returns: The namespace URI to which the prefix maps or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no matching prefix is found.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.ResolveEntity
member.summary: Resolves the entity reference for EntityReference nodes.
member.exception: SgmlReader does not resolve or return entities.

member.name: M:Sgml.SgmlReader.ReadAttributeValue
member.summary: Parses the attribute value into one or more Text, EntityReference, or EndEntity nodes.
member.returns: true if there are nodes to return. false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute node when the initial call is made or if all the attribute values have been read. An empty attribute, such as, misc="", returns true with a single node with a value of string.Empty.

member.name: T:Sgml.DesktopEntityResolver
member.summary: A special implementation for IEntityResolver that uses System.IO to access local files and HttpWebRequest for web content.

member.name: P:Sgml.DesktopEntityResolver.Proxy
member.summary: Get or set the WebProxy to use for web requests.

member.name: M:Sgml.DesktopEntityResolver.GetContent(System.Uri)
member.summary: Open the given Uri. If the Uri is relative then it could be referring to either a local file or an embedded resource.
member.param: the absolute or relative Uri of the resource to load
member.returns: The stream, or throws exception if the resource is not found
